data.title: Louisiana Ragin' Cajuns
data.meta_description: Frank Bartley (4) Guard - • 2018 Pete Maravich Memorial Award • 2018 LSWA Player of the Year • 2018 First-Team All-Louisiana • 2018 First-Team NABC All-Distr...
data.text:
• 2018 Pete Maravich Memorial Award

• 2018 LSWA Player of the Year

• 2018 First-Team All-Louisiana

• 2018 First-Team NABC All-District

• 2018 U.S. Basketball Writers Association All-District

• 2018 Sun Belt Conference All-Tournament

• 2018 First-Team All-Sun Belt Conference

• 2018 2x LSWA Player of the Week

• Sun Belt Conference Player of the Week (11/28/17)

• 2017 Cayman Islands Classic All-Tournament

• 2017 Sun Belt Conference Newcomer of the Year

• 2017 Third-Team All-Sun Belt Conference

• 2017 LSWA Newcomer of the Year

• 2017 Third-team All-Louisiana

• Sun Belt Conference Player of the Week (11/29/16)

2017-18: The recipient of the Pete Maravich Memorial Award, presented to the Major College Player of the Year by the Louisiana Association of Basketball Coaches ... named the Louisiana Sports Writers Association Player of the Year and was both a first-team All-Sun Belt Conference and NABC All-District selection ... averaged 17.8 points, 3.9 rebounds, 2.0 assists and 1.4 steals per game ... led the Sun Belt Conference in free throw percentage converting on 141 of his 164 attempts (.860) ... finished seventh in the league in scoring and was 10th in field goal percentage (.433), ninth in steals, third in 3-point field goal percentage (.383), fifth in 3-pointers made per game (2.6) and the team leader in minutes played (30.7/gm) ... played in 33 games during the season and scored in double figures in 32 straight contests after opening the season with a season-low three points at Ole Miss (11/10) ... reached the 20-point mark in 12 games during the season with season-high 26 points coming in a win at UT Arlington (1/18) ... averaged 21.5 points in a six-game stretch in February ... began the stint with a 22-point effort at ULM (2/3) before scoring 21 points in games at Georgia State (2/8) and Georgia Southern (2/10) ... scored 18 points against Texas State (2/15) before scoring 25 points against UTA (2/17) and 22 points at Troy (2/22) ... led the Cajuns with 23 points in the Sun Belt Conference Tournament opener against Texas State (3/9) before scoring 19 points against UTA (3/10) in the semifinals ... capped off the season with 21 points against LSU (3/14) in the NIT ... averaged 19.7 points at the inaugural Cayman Islands Classic, earning all-tournament honors and helping Louisiana to a third-place finish ... opened the tournament with 17 points, four rebounds and four assists in an 80-71 win over Big 10 opponent Iowa (11/20) ... added 19 points against eventual runner-up Wyoming (11/21) before scoring 23 points with a career-high six steals against Richmond (11/22) in the third-place game ... scored 18 points against Arkansas State (3/1) to become the 47th player in school history to score 1,000 points in his Ragin' Cajuns career ... became the ninth player in school history to reach the 1,000-point career scoring mark in two seasons, joining a list of players that included - Dwight "Bo" Lamar, Andrew Toney, Shawn Long, Kevin Brooks, Jerry Flake, Roy Ebron, Sydney Grider and Elvin Ivory ... sank season-high five 3-pointers in games against Savannah State (11/17), Appalachian State (1/4), Texas State (3/9) and LSU (3/14) ... went a perfect 9-for-9 from the free throw line in games against Richmond (11/22) and UT Arlington (1/18).

2016-17: Played and started in all 33 games for the Ragin' Cajuns finishing as the second-leading scorer on the team ... averaged 15.3 points, 4.3 rebounds, 2.6 assists and 1.7 steals per game while leading the team in 3-pointers attempted (190) and 3-pointers made (68) ... finished among the Sun Belt Conference leaders in scoring, assists, steals, free throw percentage (.718) and 3-pointers made per game (2.1) ... scored 20 or more points in nine games during the season ... scored a career-high 31 points, going 10-for-18 from the floor and 7-for-15 from behind the 3-point line, at Georgia State (2/4) ... overcame a two-point performance in the season-opener at Minnesota (11/11) to score 29 points with six 3-pointers at Montana State (11/14) ... named the Sun Belt Conference Player of the Week after scoring 25 points vs. Delaware State (11/21) and 28 points at James Madison (11/23) ... went 10-for-16 from the floor and added five steals against JMU ... scored 21 points on 9 of 14 shooting with five steals in road win at Appalachian State (2/27) ... scored 22 points, going 7-for-14 from the floor, 4-for-7 from behind the 3-point line and 4 of 5 from the free throw line, in the regular-season finale against UTA (3/4) ... dished out three assists and added four steals against the Mavs ... scored 18 points with seven rebounds and eight assists vs. Arkansas State (1/30) ... recorded 18 points with five steals in a win over Louisiana Tech (12/10) ... participated with Reach USA on an two-week, eight-game trip to China during the summer.

2015-16: Transferred to UL before the fall semester and sat out the season to observe the NCAA Transfer Rule.

2014-15 (at BYU): Played in 33 games on the season, averaging 2.5 points and 1.8 rebounds ...finished 24-63 (.381) from the floor, 7-for-24 (.292) from behind the 3-point line and 27 of 44 (.614) from the free throw line ... finished tied for second on the team in blocked shots (11) ... posted season high nine points, with three rebounds, three assists and one block against St. Mary's (2/12/15) ... scored seven points with four rebounds, one assist and three blocks against Pacific (2/14/15) ... scored four points while posting season-highs in rebounds (six) and assists (seven) against Southern Virginia (11/19/14).

2013-14 (at BYU): Appeared in 34 games for the Cougars as a freshman, averaging 3.9 points and 2.1 rebounds per contest ... scored in double figures in five games on the season, highlighted by 16-point effort against Mount St. Mary's (11/15/13) ... scored 14 points in games against Utah State (11/30/13) and Massachusetts (12/7/13) ... scored 11 points in victory over Texas (11/25/13) and 10 in win over Colorado Mesa (11/16/13) ... came off the bench to score 10 points and grab four rebounds against Oregon (3/20/14) in the NCAA Men's Basketball Championships ... added nine points and four rebounds against Gonzaga (3/11/14) in the West Coast Conference Tournament ... grabbed a season-high seven rebounds against Mount St. Mary's (11/15/13) ... tied season-high with seven boards and dished out season-high four assists at Loyola Marymount (12/28/13).

2012-13 (at Future Prep): Spent the season at Future College Prep in Carson, Calif. ... averaged 19.7 points, 8.5 rebounds, 6.7 assists, 3.3 steals and 1.0 blocks per game ... led FCP to a 52-13 record and the West Coast Prep title.

High School: Led Christian Life Academy to a 26-7 record and the 2012 Class 1A state title ... coached by Mark Cascio ... named first-team all-state and the LSWA Class 1A MVP ... named the District 7-1A co-MVP after averaging 14.2 points, 6.2 rebounds and 3.3 assists ... named the District 7-1 MVP as a junior and was selected to the Class 1A all-state and all-metro teams ... also lettered in football, where he posted over 800 yards receiving as a senior.

Personal: Born Feb. 25, 1994 in New Orleans, La. ... is the son of Janice and Frank Bartley, III ... has three sisters (Domonique, Jacqueline and Nicole) ... his father was a linebacker at UL from 1974-78 and holds school-records for most tackles in a game (30) and season (208) ... majoring in sociology.
